# examples of using plotly 

goal: create two interactive plots

we're going to use the "Instacart", "NY NOAA", "NYC Restaurant Inspections" data

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
```

# Load and clean data

```{r}
# 134 aisles
load(file='instacart.rda')
instacart %>% 
  count(aisle) %>% 
  filter(n > 10000) %>% 
  arrange(desc(n))

instacart_sub = 
  instacart %>% 
  filter(
    aisle %in% c("fresh vegetables", "fresh fruits", "packaged vegetables fruits")) %>% 
  group_by(aisle) %>% 
  count(product_name) %>% 
  mutate(rank = min_rank(desc(n))) %>% 
  filter(rank < 4) %>% 
  arrange(desc(n)) %>% 
  as_tibble()
  
  
```

# scatter plot

```{r}
instacart_sub %>% 
  mutate(product_name = fct_reorder(product_name, desc(n))) %>% 
  plot_ly(x = ~product_name, y = ~n, color = ~aisle, 
          type = "scatter", mode = "markers")
```

# bar plot

```{r}
instacart_sub %>% 
  mutate(product_name = fct_reorder(product_name, desc(n))) %>% 
  plot_ly(x = ~product_name, y = ~n, color = ~product_name, 
          type = "bar", colors = "viridis")
```
